alert.note: Alert for Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 06 at 11:57AM MST until January 08 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SUNDAY TO 11 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 5 inches, expect 4 to 8 inches above 7500 feet with locally higher amounts of up to 10 inches across the peaks of the Sangre De Cristo Mountains. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Northern and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains, and Upper Rio Grande Valley. * WHEN...From 6 AM Sunday to 11 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow is expected from Sunday evening through Monday morning. Areas of blowing snow will be possible during this time period dropping visibilities below half a mile at times.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley
